name: Making the ECB Filter to cover the ECB Archives (2002-2010): A search engine for 2000+ ECB builds?
author: Orion

posts.author: Orion
posts.content:
Hi everyone!

Doesntplayanymore (DPA) has created a brilliant search engine function to find builds with his programming skills whilst on his vacation.

Such a search engine is only as good as the data supplied to it. The ECB Filter currently covers 2011 to August 2019 and about 310 build entries which is great, but we can make it even better.

I think the biggest improvement to the ECB filter would be to complete the dataset by adding the ECB archives 2002-2010. This is an additional 8-9 years worth of builds which would probably more than double the number of builds in the filter. Mithdradates for example, wrote 60-70+ builds on his own. Cinnabar Din, Grimnir, Grizzled_Dwarflord, Ithacan, Thax'ylssia, TyrTemplar are just a handful of other authors who have been very prolific.

By expanding the database, DPA will have created a comprehensive 'one stop' search engine to allow all NWN players to search for whatever ECB builds they would like. DPA has improved on the http://world-of-greyhawk.github.io/buil ... index.html search engine so it would only make sense to enable his search engine to access this data.

I've liaised with DPA about the idea and he is keen on it.

Imagine if DPA's search engine could search for example, approximately 1000 ECB builds? How powerful would that be?

The dataset will be added in reverse chronological order (ie 2010, then 2009, then 2008 etc etc). The dataset will be limited to ECB builds only and the first part of the project will only include level 40 builds. Further parts of the project will be to include Level 20, Level 30 and Free Builds from the archives. 

I'm happy to take responsibility for coordinating this, ensuring data validity with the search function, using my search skills to try to comprehensively identify all builds from a particular year and supplying it to the individuals doing data entry, and helping with data entry

I'm a big believer in teamwork and Aquarius233 will be helping with data entry. 

If anyone else is interested in data entry please let me know! DPA was able to update 2.5 years worth of builds in about a day. I think there will be more builds closer to the games release date, so there will be more data to enter as we approach 2004-2006. Even so I think such a project will be completed rapidly with a few people on board, more hands make light work!

posts.author: DoesntPlayAnymore
posts.content:
I think this a good idea BUT; I think effort should be focused on completing the current filter - adding possible variations from threads with multiple builds, mostly, and error checking.

One reason is that for local storage of builds I'll (probably) need to modify the tool used to fetch pages. Waiting a bit will synchronize with my own progress on the Archive since I have not even begun fetching anything.

Another is: I may have time to create some tools to help with making the .xls lines. 1000 or so builds is no joke and I think not having to for instance fill out class level spread, some of the characterization, author name etc. for a few/some/most of the builds will be a big time saver. 

Even just making a GUI editor with boxes for everything so The Scriber doesn't have to interface with the slow and clunky excel program seems like an improvement. I've done this sort of thing to help a friend who had 65k lines of weather data he had to transform in various ways and with Python it is very manageable and I think worth the time and effort. Can also put some anti-duplication into it.

Lastly, I want to release something soon-ish. I don't want to wait several weeks before The Archive 2.0 comes out.

posts.author: Kalistez
posts.content:
One thing to be aware of is that many of the early builds were made prior to patch 1.69, and are therefore no longer legal.

I'm not sure if you are able to filter by patch number based on dates ( or even if anyone knows the dates that the patches dropped), or if we just need to add a disclaimer in somewhere.

I'm pretty sure it will only effect those builds with Dragon Shape or Epic Dodge, and that said they still provide a good basis for an updated version - just like Order of Jormungandr has recently.
